revised_title: An Analysis of 18th Century Meteorological Diaries and Observations
tldr: The article presents a detailed account of various meteorological diaries and observations communicated to the Royal Society for the years 1729 and 1730. The author, Geo. Hadley, provides a summary of each diary, discussing the methods and observations made by the diarists, including the use of barometers, thermometers, and weather recordings. The article highlights the importance of these early meteorological studies and their relevance to understanding 18th-century climate patterns.
